310000.notes: China's semiconductor capital with Big Fund HQ allocating ~21.5B CNY and municipal IC fund exceeding 100B CNY. Zhangjiang Hi-Tech Park hosts 1,000+ IC firms across the full value chain from design (UNISOC) to equipment (AMEC, SMEE) to EDA (Empyrean). SMIC Lingang targeting 100K wpm represents the city's push to scale advanced foundry capacity despite US restrictions.

semiconductor.source: Shanghai Municipal Government (via Shanghai Kechuang Group, Shanghai Guosheng Group, Shanghai International Group et al.)
semiconductor.target: Shanghai IC Industry Investment Fund Phase I (上海集成电路产业投资基金一期)
semiconductor.note: Registered capital 28.5B CNY (实缴175.6B). Invested in SMIC, Hua Hong HLMC, ACM Research Shanghai, Ziguang Zhanrui, etc. Some sources cite 24B registered capital.

semiconductor.source: Shanghai Municipal Government (Pudong New Area, Lingang Fund, Shanghai Guosheng Group et al.)
semiconductor.target: Shanghai IC Industry Investment Fund Phase II (上海集成电路产业投资基金二期)
semiconductor.note: Originally 14.53B, increased to 24.06B (~66% jump). Invested in 16 companies across Phases I+II including SMIC, Chaosi Semiconductor, Ziguang Zhanrui, Jita Semiconductor.

semiconductor.source: Shanghai State-owned Capital Investment Leading IC PE Fund + Pudong Venture Capital
semiconductor.target: Shanghai IC Industry Investment Fund Phase III (上海集成电路产业投资基金三期)
semiconductor.note: Registered capital expanded 11-fold from 0.5B to 6B. Shanghai State-owned Capital IC Fund investing 4.5B, Pudong VC 0.5B. Feb 2026 reports.

semiconductor.source: National IC Industry Investment Fund Phase I (Big Fund I)
semiconductor.target: SMIC — equity investment via Xinxin (Hong Kong) Investment Co.
semiconductor.note: ~15B CNY estimated. Big Fund I acquired ~15.76% stake pre-STAR Market IPO. Since reduced to ~6.91% as of Mar 2025.

semiconductor.source: National IC Industry Investment Fund Phase III (Big Fund III) + ICBC, ABC, BOC, CCB, BoCom, PSBC
semiconductor.target: SMIC South (SMSC) — capital increase
semiconductor.note: $7.778B total capital increase (registered capital from $6.5B to $10.077B). Big Fund III becomes new shareholder. SMIC stake rises to 41.56%.

semiconductor.target: SMIC North China (中芯北方) — acquisition of remaining 49%
semiconductor.note: CNY 40.6B share issuance to acquire remaining 49% equity; SMIC North becomes wholly-owned subsidiary.

semiconductor.target: SMIC SN2 Lingang 12-inch wafer fab
semiconductor.note: $8.87B total investment. JV structure: SMIC ≥51%, government up to 25%. 100K wafers/month capacity, 28nm+.

semiconductor.source: National IC Industry Investment Fund Phase II (Big Fund II)
semiconductor.target: Hua Hong Semiconductor — A-share IPO subscription
semiconductor.note: Big Fund II earmarked 3B CNY for Hua Hong's STAR Market IPO. Total raise 21.2B CNY.

semiconductor.target: Shanghai three-industry mother fund — IC portion (part of 100B total across IC, AI, biopharma)
semiconductor.note: Part of 100B CNY ($13.8B) across three sectors. IC fund is the largest portion (~45B). Leveraged 17.2B in social capital in 9 months.

ai_compute.target: Shanghai AI Industry Mother Fund (上海人工智能产业母基金)
ai_compute.note: 225B CNY. Prioritizes AI chips, software, autonomous driving, robotics. Part of the 100B three-industry package.

ai_compute.target: Lingang New Area semiconductor/AI 15% CIT incentive zone
ai_compute.note: 15% corporate income tax rate (vs 25% standard) for first 5 years for IC/AI enterprises. Up to 50% R&D cost matching grants. Import duty exemptions.

fabs.name: Hua Hong Wuxi Fab9 Phase I (300mm)

320000.notes: China's densest fab belt along Wuxi-Nanjing-Suzhou corridor with highest IC revenue nationally at 324B CNY. Big Fund allocated ~10B CNY with provincial IC fund at 20B+. JCET is China's #1 OSAT by revenue. SK Hynix Wuxi produces 30-40% of the company's total DRAM output, making Jiangsu a critical node in global memory supply chains.

semiconductor.source: National IC Industry Investment Fund Phase I (Big Fund I)
semiconductor.target: JCET Group (长电科技) — non-public offering subscription
semiconductor.note: 2.6B CNY subscription in 3.62B total raise. Big Fund became largest shareholder at 19%. Later reduced to ~17% by 2021.

semiconductor.source: National IC Industry Investment Fund Phase I (Big Fund I) + Tongfu Microelectronics
semiconductor.target: Tongfu Microelectronics (通富微电) — acquisition of AMD Suzhou + AMD Penang (85% stakes each)
semiconductor.note: $371M joint acquisition. Tongfu is the only A-share company with investment from both Big Fund I and II.

semiconductor.source: Jiangsu Strategic Emerging Industries Flagship Fund + Wuxi Municipal Government
semiconductor.target: Wuxi IC Industry Special Fund (无锡集成电路产业专项基金)
semiconductor.note: 5B CNY total. First sub-fund: China Electronics Tech (Wuxi) Fundamental Electronic Industry Fund, 2B CNY, full IC value chain.

semiconductor.source: SK Hynix (with China Development Bank-led syndicate loan)
semiconductor.target: SK Hynix Wuxi DRAM fab — cumulative investment
semiconductor.note: $14B cumulative investment. CDB-led syndicate loan was $3.5B — largest foreign currency loan in Jiangsu history. 180K wafers/month 10nm-class DRAM.

semiconductor.target: SK Hynix Wuxi C2F expansion
semiconductor.note: 950B KRW (~$835M / ~6B CNY) from June 2017 to April 2019. 58,000m2 building.

semiconductor.source: Hua Hong Semiconductor + Big Fund Phase II + Wuxi Government Entity
semiconductor.target: Hua Hong Wuxi FAB9 (second 12-inch line) — Phase 1
semiconductor.note: $6.7B total. Big Fund II invested $1.17B. Hua Hong contributed $4.02B new capital + $2.68B debt. Targeting 65/55/40nm, 20K wafers/month by 2025.

semiconductor.target: TSMC Nanjing 12-inch fab (Fab 16) — original investment
semiconductor.note: $3B initial investment. Wholly-owned subsidiary TSMC (Nanjing) Co. Ltd. 16nm initial, later expanded 28nm.

semiconductor.target: TSMC Nanjing 28nm expansion
semiconductor.note: $2.88B expansion for 28nm process. Nanjing local government provided substantial subsidies — TSMC received NT$47.5B ($1.51B) from China+Japan combined in 2023 alone.

semiconductor.target: TSMC Nanjing — government subsidies
semiconductor.note: Estimated ~10B+ CNY in cumulative subsidies. TSMC disclosed NT$47.5B ($1.51B) combined China+Japan subsidies in 2023, up 574% YoY. Majority from Nanjing expansion.

semiconductor.target: Nanjing IC Industry Development Fund target
semiconductor.note: $20B announced target. Nanjing Huaiyin District invested 2B+ CNY in Dehuai Semiconductor in 2017.

semiconductor.source: Suzhou High-tech Zone + local government guidance funds + corporates
semiconductor.target: Suzhou High-tech Zone IC Fund
semiconductor.note: 10B CNY ($1.4B) target. Initial commitments 3B. Focus: IC design, 5G communications, next-gen IT.

ai_compute.target: Various AI computing centers across Jiangsu (Nanjing, Wuxi, Suzhou)
ai_compute.note: Multiple municipal AI computing centers established. Specific investment amounts not individually disclosed in public sources. Part of national East-West Computing Transfer project.

440000.notes: Huawei/HiSilicon anchors the GBA ecosystem with ~83.4B CNY revenue. Provincial IC/AI fund exceeds 100B CNY with Big Fund Phase III growing allocation. Shenzhen produces 1/5 of China's ICs, 40% of global smartphones, and 70% of global drones. Guangdong is the demand-side heavyweight -- massive downstream pull from consumer electronics drives upstream IC design investment.

semiconductor.target: CanSemi Guangzhou 12-inch fab (3 phases)
Zenxin semiconductor project (Guangdong)
Saimi Semiconductor Industry Fund

ai_compute.target: Shaoguan Data Center cluster
AI + Manufacturing integration plan
Pazhou AI Industry Fund
AI + Robotics Industry Fund
Longgang AI computing center

110000.notes: China's semiconductor policy center and home to Big Fund management (all 3 phases). Big Fund allocated ~15B CNY to Beijing-based projects. NAURA is China's #1 equipment maker (~30B CNY revenue, 6th globally). R&D intensity at 6.73% is China's highest. AI revenue exceeds 300B CNY with 1,250+ AI companies -- the densest AI cluster in the country.

semiconductor.source: National IC Industry Investment Fund Phase I (Big Fund I)
semiconductor.target: SMIC — equity investment

semiconductor.source: National IC Industry Investment Fund Phase II (Big Fund II)
semiconductor.target: SMIC — additional equity investment

semiconductor.source: National IC Industry Investment Fund Phase III (Big Fund III) + ICBC, ABC, BOC, CCB, BoCom, PSBC
semiconductor.target: SMIC South (SMSC) — capital increase
SMIC North China (中芯北方) — acquisition of remaining 49%
NAURA capacity expansion
Haidian IC Industry Fund
Yizhuang 500B CNY umbrella fund for strategic industries
semiconductor.note: Umbrella fund across all strategic industries, not exclusively semiconductor

ai_compute.target: E-class AI Computing Center (Beijing)
Yizhuang AI industry investment

ai_compute.source: Ministry of Science and Technology / Beijing
ai_compute.target: National AI Industry Investment Fund (HQ Beijing)
ai_compute.note: National fund headquartered in Beijing

330000.notes: Hangzhou announced a 1T CNY AI industry fund plan, signaling aggressive tournament play in AI compute. Alibaba T-Head designs Yitian 710 server and Hanguang 800 inference chips. Silan is one of China's largest power semi IDMs. Strong fabless design hub but limited 300mm fab capacity leaves Zhejiang dependent on YRD neighbors for manufacturing.

semiconductor.source: Silan Microelectronics (士兰微) + Hangzhou Qiantang New District
semiconductor.target: Silan 12-inch integrated circuit production line (Hangzhou)
semiconductor.note: 17B CNY ($2.6B) total. IC chip production in Qiantang New District. 220K units/month actual output, world #2 in ≤6-inch chips.

semiconductor.source: National IC Industry Investment Fund (Big Fund I/II)
semiconductor.target: Silan Microelectronics 12-inch chip project
semiconductor.note: 600M CNY from ICF for Silan's 12-inch project launched 2021.

ai_compute.target: Hangzhou AI Industry Fund (杭州人工智能产业基金) — 100B+ target
ai_compute.note: 100B+ CNY ($13.9B) target. '3+N' fund cluster leveraging social and financial capital. 50 EFLOPS intelligent computing power target by end 2025.

ai_compute.target: Alibaba Cloud AI and cloud infrastructure (global, HQ Hangzhou)
ai_compute.note: 380B CNY ($52.4B) over 3 years — exceeds past decade of capex. Global scope but Hangzhou-anchored. 1M+ servers planned across Nantong, Hangzhou, Ulanqab.

340000.notes: Hefei is China's most aggressive municipal semiconductor investor, pioneering the 'Hefei Model' of direct equity stakes in CXMT and NIO. Big Fund deployed ~10B CNY (primarily CXMT) with Hefei IC fund at 30B CNY. IC revenue grew at 75.5% CAGR 2018-23 -- the fastest in China. CXMT achieved 80% DDR5 yield and is China's only volume DRAM maker, targeting 300K wpm by 2026.

semiconductor.source: Hefei Municipal Government (via Hefei Jiantou 合肥建投 + Hefei Chantou 合肥产投)
semiconductor.target: BOE 6th-generation LCD production line (template investment — the Hefei Model)
semiconductor.note: Government invested 3B CNY (two platforms, 1.5B each). Leveraged to 12B total raise. Hefei's annual fiscal revenue was only 16.1B at the time. Floating gains exceeded 10B+ at peak.

semiconductor.target: CXMT (ChangXin Memory Technologies 长鑫存储) — founding investment ('506 Project')
semiconductor.note: ~54B CNY in provincial government funding for the '506 Project'. City government shouldered ~75% of initial capital. Groundbreaking 2017, first DDR4 chip 2019.

semiconductor.source: National IC Industry Investment Fund Phase II (Big Fund II) + Hefei government affiliates
semiconductor.target: Changxin Xinqiao Memory Technologies (长鑫新桥) — capital increase
semiconductor.note: 39B CNY ($5.4B). Big Fund II + two Hefei government-affiliated investors. Targeting 3-year mass production timeline.

semiconductor.target: CXMT IPO — proceeds for DRAM manufacturing upgrades
semiconductor.note: 29.5B CNY ($4.22B) IPO planned. 10.6B shares. Implied valuation ~300B CNY ($43B). Proceeds for DRAM wafer lines, process upgrades, R&D.

semiconductor.source: Hefei City Construction and Investment Holding Group (国资) + Powerchip (Taiwan)
semiconductor.target: Nexchip Semiconductor (合肥晶合集成) — founding JV
semiconductor.note: JV between Hefei state-owned Jiantou and Taiwanese Powerchip. Now China's 3rd largest foundry.

semiconductor.target: Nexchip Phase IV expansion (合肥晶合四期)
semiconductor.note: 35.5B CNY ($5.07B). Construction began Jan 2026. Equipment install Q4 2026, full capacity Q2 2028. 12-inch mature-node expansion.

semiconductor.source: Hefei Municipal Government (via Hefei Xinping Industrial Investment Fund 合肥芯屏产业投资基金)
semiconductor.target: Hefei Chip-Screen Fund ('Xinping Fund') — strategic industries fund
semiconductor.note: Focus on semiconductors and display panels. Exact fund size not publicly confirmed; part of broader Hefei venture capital ecosystem.

ai_compute.target: Hefei AI and advanced computing infrastructure
ai_compute.note: Hefei has established multiple AI computing centers as part of East-West Computing Transfer. Specific investment figures not individually disclosed.

420000.notes: YMTC received the single largest Big Fund allocation at ~19B CNY, making Hubei a top recipient of central government semiconductor capital. Wuhan IC fund adds 30B+ CNY. YMTC is China's 3D NAND champion (270-layer) and expanding despite US sanctions since Oct 2022. Optics Valley hosts 300+ chip enterprises with a 600B CNY optoelectronic industry.

semiconductor.target: YMTC (Yangtze Memory Technologies) — total cumulative investment

semiconductor.source: National IC Industry Investment Fund Phase I (Big Fund I)
semiconductor.target: YMTC — equity investment

semiconductor.source: National IC Industry Investment Fund Phase II (Big Fund II)
semiconductor.target: YMTC — additional equity investment
YMTC Phase III expansion
Hubei IC Industry Fund
Wuhan Hongxin Semiconductor (HSMC) — 14nm/7nm fab (FAILED)
semiconductor.note: 128B CNY announced, only ~2B CNY actual investment before collapse. Operations ceased 2020.

semiconductor.target: XMC NOR Flash / foundry expansion
Changfei SiC project (Hubei)

ai_compute.target: Wuhan AI Computing Center
Optics Valley Industry Fund (光谷产业基金)
ai_compute.note: Broader fund covering optoelectronics, AI, and semiconductor sectors

370000.notes: Shandong competes on SiC materials rather than logic fabs. SICC is world's #2 SiC substrate maker, Tianyue holds the world's first 12-inch SiC substrate. Inspur is China's #1 AI server maker, giving the province weight in compute infrastructure. Modest IC industry but large economic base and moderate R&D intensity support gradual scaling.

semiconductor.target: Jinan Funenergy Semiconductor (济南富能半导体) — 8/12-inch fabs
semiconductor.note: Phase 1 investment 6B CNY. Planned two 8-inch and one 12-inch fabs. Provincial key support project. Trial production began 2020.

semiconductor.target: Jinan Quanxin IC Manufacturing (济南泉芯集成电路) — 12-inch fab (FAILED)
semiconductor.note: 59.8B CNY planned. Claimed 7nm target. FAILED: capital chain broke, no equipment orders, no construction. Operations suspended by 2021. Classic zombie fab.

semiconductor.target: Shandong major projects list — 1 trillion total across sectors
semiconductor.note: Shandong released 1T CNY major project list for 2024 across all sectors. Semi/AI not individually broken out.

ai_compute.target: Shandong first AI computing center (山东首个人工智能算力中心) — operations began
ai_compute.note: Shandong's first AI computing center officially entered operation in 2025. Exact investment amount not disclosed in available public sources.

510000.notes: Chengdu announced a 50B CNY AI fund, aggressively competing with eastern cities for AI investment. Intel's largest China A/T facility received a $300M expansion in Oct 2024. Hygon/Haiguang revenue hit 9.15B CNY (2024, +52% YoY) with 600B+ market cap, making Chengdu a rising center for domestic x86/DCU chip design.

semiconductor.target: Intel Products (Chengdu) — OSAT facility Phase 1
semiconductor.note: $525M cumulative by 2006 including microprocessor factory

semiconductor.target: Intel Products (Chengdu) — server chip packaging expansion
semiconductor.note: $300M announced Oct 2024

semiconductor.target: TI Semiconductor Manufacturing (Chengdu) — 200mm fab
semiconductor.note: Up to $275M initial; $1.69B total planned over 15 years

semiconductor.target: TI Chengdu — UTAC facility acquisition for assembly/test
semiconductor.note: Undisclosed acquisition; part of $1.69B 15-year plan

ai_compute.target: Chengdu Smart Computing Center (成都智算中心) — Ascend 300P
ai_compute.note: Total project investment 109B CNY; 300P FP16 Ascend AI cluster

ai_compute.target: Chengdu AI Industry Fund (成都人工智能产业基金)
ai_compute.note: 50B CNY total target; first close 1B CNY. Broader 15B fund cluster planned.

ai_compute.target: Tianfu Data Center Cluster (天府数据中心集群) — East-West Computing
ai_compute.note: Sichuan Energy Investment Tianfu Cloud Data Base alone is 10B CNY; 500 mu site, 50K cabinets

610000.notes: Samsung's Xi'an complex is one of the world's largest NAND facilities (~15% of global NAND output), but foreign-owned capacity doesn't translate to provincial tournament leverage. Provincial 'Strong Chip Project' is modest at ~10B CNY. The tension: Xi'an hosts massive fab capacity it doesn't control, while trying to build domestic design capability with 120+ IC design companies.

semiconductor.target: Samsung Xi'an NAND Fab — Plant 1 (Phase 1 + Phase 2)
semiconductor.note: ~$10B USD total for first plant. Groundbreaking Sep 2012, production May 2014.

semiconductor.target: Samsung Xi'an NAND Fab — Plant 2 Phase 1
semiconductor.note: $7B USD. Agreement signed Aug 2017 with Shaanxi provincial government.

semiconductor.target: Samsung Xi'an NAND Fab — Plant 2 Phase 2
semiconductor.note: $8B USD. Announced Dec 2019, completed mid-2021.

semiconductor.target: Samsung Xi'an NAND — CUMULATIVE TOTAL
semiconductor.note: Total $25.87B USD (31.536T KRW) cumulative investment across all phases. One of largest single foreign investments in China.

semiconductor.source: Shaanxi Provincial Government / Xi'an Municipal / Big Fund
semiconductor.target: Shaanxi IC Industry Investment Fund (陕西省集成电路产业投资基金)
semiconductor.note: Initial 6B CNY; target 30B CNY. First close 3.33B from provincial/city/district.

ai_compute.target: Xi'an Future AI Computing Center (西安未来人工智能计算中心) — Ascend 300P→500P
ai_compute.note: ~1.9B CNY Phase 1 (19B total project including R&D center). 300P initial, expanded to 500P, planned 1000P.

350000.notes: Fujian's tournament bid collapsed with JHICC's 2018 US sanctions (Micron IP theft), a cautionary tale for provincial tech ambitions funded by government equity. Sanan Optoelectronics now leads China's compound semiconductor charge from Xiamen. United Semi (28nm) operates under UMC license. Provincial investment focus has shifted from memory to compound semi and specialty foundry.

semiconductor.source: National IC Industry Investment Fund Phase I (Big Fund I)
semiconductor.target: San'an Optoelectronics (三安光电) — equity investment
semiconductor.note: 4.7B CNY from Big Fund I. San'an is China's leading compound semiconductor IDM (LED, SiC, GaN). HQ in Xiamen, Fujian.

semiconductor.source: San'an Optoelectronics + Changsha Pilot Investment Holdings + Big Fund
semiconductor.target: Hunan Sanan Semiconductor — vertically integrated SiC fab (Changsha)
semiconductor.note: 16B CNY (~$2.5B). First vertically integrated SiC line in China. Opened June 2021. 15K wafers/month Phase 1, 30K planned Phase 2. Note: physically in Hunan but San'an is a Fujian company.

semiconductor.source: Silan Microelectronics + Xiamen Semiconductor Investment Group
semiconductor.target: Silan + Xiamen SIG — 4/6-inch compound semiconductor device line (Xiamen Haicang)
semiconductor.note: 5B CNY ($756M) joint investment. Advanced compound semiconductor production in Haicang district, Xiamen.

semiconductor.source: Fujian Provincial Government + Chinese National Government
semiconductor.target: Fujian Jinhua Integrated Circuit (JHICC 晋华集成电路) — DRAM fab
semiconductor.note: $5.6B total investment. UMC technology partnership. US Entity List Oct 2018 killed the project — operations suspended by Mar 2019. Micron settlement Dec 2023.

semiconductor.source: UMC + Xiamen Finance Department + Fujian Electronics & Information Group
semiconductor.target: United Semiconductor (Xiamen) (联芯集成电路 USCXM) — 12-inch foundry JV
semiconductor.note: UMC invested $1.35B initially. Total project $6.2B when fully equipped (50K wafers/month). UMC acquired full ownership in 2023 for CNY 4.858B ($677.76M).

semiconductor.target: Xiamen Semiconductor Investment Group (厦门半导体投资集团) — establishment
semiconductor.note: Established Dec 2016. Investment, M&A, and capital operations in semiconductor industry. Part of broader Fujian IC investment ecosystem (Xiamen + Jinjiang funds reportedly exceeding 150B CNY combined).

semiconductor.source: National IC Industry Investment Fund Phase II (Big Fund II)
semiconductor.target: Big Fund II — new subsidiary established in Xiamen
semiconductor.note: Big Fund II established a new company in Xiamen in June 2025, signaling continued investment focus on Fujian's semiconductor sector.

210000.notes: SK Hynix completed $9B acquisition of Intel's Dalian NAND fab in April 2025, producing ~100K wpm of 192-layer NAND (~20% of SK Hynix total NAND output). Like Shaanxi, Liaoning has massive foreign-owned fab capacity it doesn't control. The commercial ecosystem beyond the fab is thin, and the province has invested minimally in tournament competition for IC industry.

semiconductor.target: Intel Fab 68 Dalian — 300mm wafer fab (original construction)
semiconductor.note: $2.5B USD. Intel's first fab in Asia. Broke ground Sep 2007, production Oct 2010. Initially chipset logic.

semiconductor.target: Intel Fab 68 Dalian — conversion to 3D NAND
semiconductor.note: Up to $5.5B USD for 3D NAND upgrade. Production began H2 2016.

semiconductor.target: Intel Dalian NAND fab + SSD business sale to SK Hynix
semiconductor.note: $9B USD total deal. Phase 1 closed Dec 2021 ($7B); Phase 2 Mar 2025 ($2B). Fab now SK Hynix.

semiconductor.target: Heraeus quartz manufacturing plant (Shenyang) — semiconductor materials
semiconductor.note: 600M CNY ($83.6M). Heraeus' largest semiconductor project in China. High-purity quartz for semicon.

ai_compute.source: Shenyang Municipal Government / Hunnan District / Huawei
ai_compute.target: Shenyang AI Computing Center (沈阳人工智能计算中心) — Ascend
ai_compute.note: 1.06B CNY joint investment. Phase 1 100P (Aug 2022), Phase 2 200P (Jun 2023), now 450P total.

fabs.name: Sanan Changsha SiC Mega Fab Phase I
Sanan Changsha SiC Mega Fab Phase II

430000.notes: Hunan is carving a niche in power/compound semiconductor rather than competing head-on in logic or memory. Changsha AI pilot zone and Sanan's $2.5B SiC Mega Fab represent targeted provincial bets. CRRC Times broke foreign IGBT monopoly in rail transit via 2008 Dynex acquisition -- a rare successful technology acquisition that informs current semiconductor policy thinking.

semiconductor.source: San'an Optoelectronics + Changsha Pilot Investment Holdings + Big Fund
semiconductor.target: Hunan Sanan Semiconductor — vertically integrated SiC fab (Changsha)
STMicro-San'an JV SiC fab (Chongqing-linked, San'an HQ Changsha)
semiconductor.note: Physical fab in Chongqing but San'an is Hunan-based company

semiconductor.target: CRRC Times Semiconductor expansion (Zhuzhou)

ai_compute.target: Changsha AI Computing Center

410000.notes: Zhengzhou AI pilot zone and a 10B CNY smart computing project signal Henan's tournament entry via compute infrastructure rather than IC manufacturing. Foxconn Zhengzhou is world's largest iPhone assembly site (300B+ CNY cumulative investment) but this is assembly, not semiconductor value-add. No wafer fabs despite being China's 5th largest economy by GDP.

ai_compute.target: Zhengzhou AI Computing Center
Airport Smart Computing Center (Zhengzhou)

500000.notes: Chongqing is competing with Changsha to become China's SiC capital. The $3.2B Sanan-STMicroelectronics JV (51/49 split) inaugurated Feb 2025 targets 480K 8-inch SiC automotive wafers/year -- the first large-scale 8-inch SiC automotive line in China. CQAOS attracted a $1.39B strategic stake from SIMIC Holdings in 2025, signaling the fab's value for power chip self-sufficiency.

semiconductor.target: 12-inch power semiconductor wafer fab (润西微电子)
semiconductor.note: 75.5B CNY total investment for 12-inch line

semiconductor.target: Power semiconductor packaging & test facility (华润润安科技)
semiconductor.note: 42B CNY planned investment

semiconductor.target: SK Hynix Chongqing — backend packaging facility
semiconductor.note: Operational packaging facility; specific investment amount not publicly disclosed. One of three SK Hynix China sites (Wuxi DRAM, Dalian NAND, Chongqing packaging).

ai_compute.target: Western (Chongqing) Science City Advanced Data Center — East-West Computing hub
ai_compute.note: Exceeds 20B CNY; Bishan District, part of Chengdu-Chongqing national hub node

120000.notes: Tianjin benefits from Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei integration as a JJJ computing hub. SMIC investing $7.5B in new 12-inch fab. High R&D intensity at 3.58% (4th nationally) reflects Tianjin's university and research base. The municipality is positioning as a cost-competitive alternative to Beijing for IC operations while riding the JJJ cluster spillover.

semiconductor.target: SMIC Tianjin 12-inch wafer fab
semiconductor.note: $7.5B total investment

130000.notes: Hebei leads China's computing power index (#1 nationally) driven by Zhangjiakou's 440K+ rack data center cluster serving Beijing's overflow. This is pure infrastructure arbitrage -- cheaper land and power adjacent to Beijing's demand center. CETC 13th Research Institute in Shijiazhuang works on GaAs/GaN for defense, but the province has essentially zero IC manufacturing capability.

ai_compute.target: Zhangjiakou Data Center cluster
Langfang Data Center cluster

companies.name: China Telecom Inner Mongolia Info Park

150000.notes: Inner Mongolia competes on the cheapest industrial power in eastern China at 0.40 CNY/kWh. Hohhot and Ulanqab host massive DC clusters with 220K racks. China Mobile operates the world's largest single-unit telecom intelligent computing center here. Over 80% of DC energy from renewables. The province's tournament strategy is pure power-cost arbitrage -- no IC capability but increasingly critical infrastructure for AI training workloads.

ai_compute.target: China Telecom Cloud Computing Inner Mongolia Information Park
ai_compute.note: 173B CNY total budget. 100.6万sqm, 42 data halls, 100K+ racks.

ai_compute.target: China Mobile Hohhot Data Center Park
ai_compute.note: Infrastructure investment exceeds 15B CNY. 18 data halls, 1.2M server capacity.

ai_compute.target: China Mobile Hohhot Smart Computing Center (智算中心)
ai_compute.note: 46.6B CNY. Largest single-cluster smart computing center by a global carrier.

ai_compute.target: Helinggeer New District — total DC cluster
ai_compute.note: 18+ large DC projects completed/under construction, total investment exceeding 100B CNY.

520000.notes: China's 'data valley' providing ~23% of national computing power. 150 EFLOPS target for 2025. Huawei deploying 1M servers in Gui'an. Central to 'East Data West Computing' national strategy. Guizhou won the early tournament round for hyperscaler DC investment by offering cheap power and land subsidies -- digital economy now equals 42% of GDP despite being one of China's poorest provinces.

semiconductor.target: Huaxintong Semiconductor (华芯通) — ARM server chip JV (FAILED)
semiconductor.note: $570M combined investment by 2018. 55% Guizhou / 45% Qualcomm. Initial capital 1.85B CNY. Shut down May 2019.

ai_compute.target: Apple iCloud (Guian) Data Center
ai_compute.note: $1B USD. Operated by Guizhou-Cloud Big Data (GCBD). Opened May 2021.

ai_compute.target: Huawei Cloud Seven Star Lake Data Center (Guian)
ai_compute.note: 8B CNY. 480K sqm, 51 buildings, capacity 1M servers. Huawei's largest global cloud DC.

ai_compute.target: Tencent Guian Seven Star Data Center (underground/tunnel)
ai_compute.note: Undisclosed exact figure. 30K sqm tunnel + 700+ mu land. 50K+ server capacity. T-block 4th gen technology.

ai_compute.target: China Mobile (Guizhou) Data Center — Phase 1-3
ai_compute.note: Phase 1-2 ~1.5B CNY; Phase 3 ~0.9B CNY. 20K+ racks total.

ai_compute.source: Multiple (Huawei, Apple, Tencent, China Mobile, China Telecom, China Unicom)
ai_compute.target: Guian New Area — 7 super-large DC projects cumulative
ai_compute.note: 9.74B CNY cumulative by Nov 2020 across 7 major DCs.

ai_compute.target: East-West Computing (东数西算) Guian cluster — total planned
ai_compute.note: 138.5B CNY total planned across start-up, development, and expansion phases.

640000.notes: Zhongwei Cloud Computing Base hosts 130K racks, 88K+ GPU cards, and 44K PFLOPS. Cheapest power nationally at 0.40 CNY/kWh (tied with Inner Mongolia). Chindata building a 1.2GW/$3.3B cluster. Ferrotec produces silicon wafer substrates. Ningxia's tournament play is identical to Inner Mongolia -- power-cost arbitrage for DC infrastructure, with some materials production upside.

ai_compute.source: Amazon AWS (via NWCD / Western Cloud Data)
ai_compute.target: AWS Zhongwei Data Center — Phase 1
ai_compute.note: First phase 1.5B CNY. 900 racks, 35K servers. Total project planned $1.5-2.5B USD over time.

ai_compute.target: China Mobile (Ningxia) Data Center Phase 2
ai_compute.note: 130.45B CNY total. 20K racks, 400K server capacity.

ai_compute.target: Zhongwei Western Cloud Base — cumulative total
ai_compute.note: 452 enterprises registered, cumulative investment 41.7B CNY (153B into statistics). 10 super-large DCs, 650K+ server capacity.

ai_compute.target: Ningxia hub — total planned fixed-asset investment
ai_compute.note: Start-up zone 5000 mu. 300B+ CNY planned fixed-asset investment. Projected 390B annual revenue at completion.

140000.notes: Coal-dominated economy slowly transitioning. Datong emerging as a data cluster leveraging cheap coal-fired power. Provincial plans mention semiconductors and digital industries but no material investment yet. The tournament calculus: Shanxi has cheap power and land but lacks talent, infrastructure, and proximity to IC demand centers -- DC infrastructure is the only realistic play.

ai_compute.target: Zhonglian Green Big Data Industrial Base (Datong)
ai_compute.note: 30B CNY total investment.

ai_compute.target: Taihang Computing Center (Datong) — Phase 1 + Phase 2
ai_compute.note: Phase 1 ~2.8B CNY, Phase 2 ~4.5B CNY. ByteDance/Volcengine.

ai_compute.target: JD North China (Datong Lingqiu) Smart Computing Data Center Base
ai_compute.note: 2.5B CNY total investment.

ai_compute.target: Datong Computing City — total planned investment
ai_compute.note: 442B CNY total planned. 282B cumulative completed. 73.6万 servers operational, ~25K P computing power.

650000.notes: China's (and the world's) polysilicon production heartland -- ultra-cheap coal power drives solar-grade polysilicon. China produced 93.5% of global polysilicon in 2024 with Xinjiang as the largest producing region. The cheapest power in China at 0.37 CNY/kWh makes it a candidate for 'East Data West Computing' expansion, but remoteness and political sensitivity limit data center growth.

ai_compute.source: Multiple (Liantai Cluster, Yunda Energy, JD Cloud, etc.)
ai_compute.target: Hami Computing Power Projects — 6 projects signed
ai_compute.note: 210B CNY total across 6 computing projects. Includes 2x 2000P and 2x 1000P smart computing centers.

ai_compute.target: Karamay Cloud Computing Industrial Park
ai_compute.note: 68K+ racks built. 70% of national rendering capacity. 3000+ film projects. Includes Huawei Cloud, PetroChina DC. Specific investment not consolidated.

360000.notes: Nanchang is one of China's four largest LED industrial areas, pioneering silicon substrate GaN LED technology. LED industry targeting 50B CNY by 2026. No mainstream logic/memory fab presence. Jiangxi has not made significant tournament bets in semiconductors, focusing instead on materials and LED packaging as a lower-cost complement to neighboring YRD provinces.

semiconductor.target: Cambricon Semiconductor Equipment Nanchang — MOCVD production
semiconductor.note: Phase 2 ~1B CNY. MOCVD equipment production/R&D. Nanchang High-tech Zone.

ai_compute.target: Longi Nanchang AI PC Factory
ai_compute.note: ~1.5B CNY. AI PC manufacturing with Qualcomm chip platform. Partnerships with Lenovo, Honor.

450000.notes: Guangxi's 11B CNY Guilin smart computing project is a notable tournament bid from an otherwise peripheral province. ASEAN trade gateway role gives some downstream electronics demand. Hot Chip Semiconductor filled a basic gap in semiconductor manufacturing. The province is largely a bystander in the IC tournament but making targeted compute infrastructure investments.

ai_compute.target: Guilin 10000P Green Smart Computing Center (桂林万P绿色智算中心)
ai_compute.note: Phase 1 ~1B CNY (1000P, target Jan 2025). Phase 2 ~10B CNY (10000P total). Leverages Huawei cloud DC.

ai_compute.target: China-ASEAN AI Computing Center (中国-东盟人工智能计算中心)
ai_compute.note: Located in Nanning. Specific investment undisclosed. Serving Guangxi AI + ASEAN cooperation.

230000.notes: HIT's 13.5nm EUV lithography light source breakthrough in early 2025 is the province's main semiconductor contribution. Harbin 200MW DC facility represents a modest compute infrastructure play. No commercial IC industry. HIT produces top talent but most graduates migrate to coastal provinces -- the brain drain undermines any tournament potential.

ai_compute.target: China Mobile AI Computing Center (Harbin) — world's largest carrier single-cluster smart computing center
ai_compute.note: 6.9 EFLOPS smart computing. 100% domestic AI chips. Largest carrier single-cluster globally. Specific CAPEX not disclosed separately.

ai_compute.target: Harbin smart computing center project
ai_compute.note: 2.5B CNY. 4000P FP8 peak computing.

ai_compute.target: Distributed computing center project
ai_compute.note: 1.5B CNY investment.

ai_compute.target: Daxinganling smart computing center
ai_compute.note: 5B CNY investment.

530000.notes: Yunnan's strategic role is upstream materials: germanium production for compound semiconductors. China controls 83% of global germanium and restricted exports to the US in Dec 2024, elevating Yunnan's strategic importance. Plans to produce 200K gallium arsenide wafers and 83K indium phosphide wafers in 2025. Cheap hydro power at 0.41 CNY/kWh could support DC buildout but remoteness limits growth.

semiconductor.source: Yunnan City Investment Group (云南城投)
semiconductor.target: Yunnan Silicon Smart Technology Town (云硅智能科技小镇) — wafer + packaging
semiconductor.note: 9000 mu site planned: 500B/yr smart terminal factory, 600万-wafer silicon fab, discrete device fab, and packaging/test. Status unclear.

ai_compute.target: Kunming AI Computing Center (昆明人工智能计算中心)
ai_compute.note: 400P planned scale, Phase 1 42P operational. Serving 40+ institutions. Specific investment amount not disclosed.

620000.notes: Huatian Technology (Tianshui) is one of China's largest OSAT companies specializing in SiP, TSV, and Fan-Out packaging -- a rare high-value semiconductor operation in western China. Qingyang designated as a computing hub under 'East Data West Computing'. Gansu's tournament position is niche: backend packaging via Huatian plus cheap-power DC infrastructure.

semiconductor.target: Tianshui Huatian Technology — OSAT headquarters & packaging/test base
semiconductor.note: Tianshui is HQ and founding base. Traditional packaging operations. Company overall invested 15B in expansion (mainly Nanjing), but Tianshui-specific capex not separately disclosed.

ai_compute.target: China Telecom East-West Computing Qingyang Computing Center
ai_compute.note: 4.47B CNY. Fully operational as of Oct 2023.

ai_compute.target: China Mobile (Gansu/Qingyang) Data Center
ai_compute.note: ~27B CNY total planned. 292 mu site.

ai_compute.target: Qingyang East-West Computing national data center cluster — 2023 projects
ai_compute.note: 16 major projects in 2023 totaling 198.1B CNY (19.81B).

ai_compute.target: Qingyang cluster — 2024 digital economy projects total
ai_compute.note: 51 projects totaling 968.48B CNY announced for 2024.

220000.notes: Changchun's optoelectronic cluster (90B+ CNY output in 2024) is the province's semiconductor-adjacent asset. Chang Guang Satellite operates China's largest commercial remote sensing constellation (Jilin-1). Not a participant in the IC tournament -- focus remains on optoelectronics and automotive electronics (FAW Group).

ai_compute.target: Changchun New District Smart Computing Center (长春新区智算中心)
ai_compute.note: 800M CNY (8B). 200P smart computing, 30K sqm. Under construction for 2024 completion.

ai_compute.target: Changchun Computing Center (长春算力中心)
ai_compute.note: Smart computing 100P (planned 300P), supercomputing 5P (planned 10P). Fully domestic tech stack. Specific investment undisclosed.

460000.notes: Hainan Free Trade Port launched Dec 2025 with 15% corporate tax and zero-tariff on 6,600+ items. Potential to attract IC design companies via tax arbitrage, but no semiconductor operations yet. The island's tournament play is purely regulatory -- tax incentives rather than industrial investment or infrastructure.

semiconductor.target: Hainan semiconductor packaging projects — Hangchip Hi-Tech Park + Xinyao PI chip packaging substrate
semiconductor.note: Part of 554 major projects totaling 85.4B CNY in 2025. Individual amounts not disclosed. Free trade port zero-tariff advantage for equipment imports.

630000.notes: Cheapest power in China (tied with Xinjiang at 0.37 CNY/kWh). Strategic lithium reserves (~10M tons brine lithium) for battery production. Qinghai Lihao Qingneng is a top-7 global polysilicon producer. Some potential for 'East Data West Computing' DC buildout on solar/hydro power, but remoteness severely limits tournament competitiveness.

ai_compute.target: China Unicom-Alibaba Cloud 10K-card Green Computing Project
ai_compute.note: Exceeds 2B CNY. Super-large computing center leveraging Qinghai's green energy advantage.

540000.notes: First large AI datacenter commissioned in 2025 but Tibet remains a non-participant in the semiconductor tournament. Remote geography, sparse population, limited infrastructure, and altitude make IC manufacturing impractical. Some lithium and rare earth mineral potential but no extraction at semiconductor-relevant scale.

ai_compute.target: No significant semiconductor or AI/compute investments identified
ai_compute.note: Tibet has minimal datacenter/computing infrastructure. No major investments found.
